title.narrative: One UN COVID-19 Response Plan for Nigeria Basket Fund

description.narrative: One UN Covid-19 Response Plan Basket Fund (the basket fund) will support the government of Nigeria’s (GoN) National Covid-19 multi sectoral response plan. It will contribute to optimum care of confirmed covid-19 cases and containment of spread of the outbreak, including through improvements in health infrastructure such as WASH facilities, and provide access to essential health services. It will also contribute to reducing other socio-economic, including through food security interventions, and conflict related impacts of the outbreak. IMPACT: Nigeria response to the COVID-19 pandemic supported by ensuring optimum care of the confirmed cases and contain further spread of the outbreak and pathway for rapid recovery and resilience is established OUTCOME: Rapid implementation of Nigeria’s National COVID-19 Multi-Sectoral Pandemic Response Plan strengthened Output 1: Rapid procurement of disease commodity packages for surveillance, prevention and control, and clinical management improved Output 2: Complementary ongoing Risk Communication Strategies for sustained community engagement and cooperation are supported Output 3: Development of tailored and decentralized response strategies at state-level aligned to the coordinated framework at the Federal level is supported Output 4: Access to essential health services maintained (this output includes improvement of WASH facilities) Output 5: Pro-active early recovery, social protection and cohesion is enhanced, targeting vulnerable groups supported (this output includes cash transfers and food distribution as food security and pro-poor measures for vulnerable groups) Output 6: Coordination of partnerships and mobilization of resources for collective response are improved
